intro: Psychotria collina, commonly known as the pink psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Lesser Antilles. The plant is characterized by its striking pink or red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Psychotria collina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
